think through this whole thing
there is no second plan there is no

we're going to be relying on groups in

we seem to be changing sides
are you against bombing in Syria under

what's happened in Vienna but the other

where are they getting their money from
they're selling oil maybe into into

there has to be a security response in

the experience of Libya where there was

would describe
an act of violence an act of war is

this is not a UN organized thing this is

he's there on the streets with a stop

heart
except wanting a peaceful world and

70,000 have already replied with their

many are thinking the whole thing

they're looking at a more
it's more nuanced approach to taking in

if the bombing goes ahead they're

Islamophobia racism or whatever else so
there has to be a political process
that's my point
when you say people are frightened about
what will happen when if the bombing

of all faiths in our society feel

clear about this if Britain votes to

unfortunately the whole record since

some quite terrifying degrees of

and that is something we've all got to
